attributes.action: refugee family allowed to move to luxury London home so they could be near friends
attributes.additional_details:
Khaliifs have been given a £2million home in one of London’s most exclusive neighbourhoods, with taxpayers funding their £8,000-a-month rent.

The family had rejected a previous six-bedroom home in Coventry - where the bill for the public would have been a more reasonable £1,000 a month - simply because they wanted to live ‘closer to their friends’.

How can this additional £7,000.00 per month be justified just because they want to be near friends
